article: When I was 16 years old I made my first visit to Disneyland in America It wasn"t the first time I had been _ Like most English children I learned French _ school and I had often been to France so I _ speaking a foreign language to people who didn"t understand _ But _ I went to America I was really looking forward to _ a nice easy holiday without any _ problems _ wrong I was! The misunderstanding began _ the airport I was looking for a _ telephone to give my friend Danny a _ and tell her that I had arrived a _ old man saw me looking lost and asked _ he could help me. Yes I said I want to give my friend a ring Well that"s nice he said Are you getting _ But aren"t you a bit young? _ is talking about marriage? I replied I just want to give my friend a ring to tell her I"ve arrived Can you tell me _ there s a phone box? Oh! he said there"s a phone downstairs When at last we did meet up Danny explained the misunderstanding to me Don"t worry she said to me I had so many _ at first There are lots of words which the Americans _ differently in meaning from us British You"ll soon get used to _ funny things they say Most of the _ , British and American people understand each other! 16.
